title: Fall of the Roman Republic
introduction: In the waning days of the Roman Republic, power is up for grabs. Factional strife, Senate intrigues, and ambitious leaders set the stage for either a new order or further chaos. As a key political figure, your decisions will determine whether Rome transitions into a stable empire or succumbs to internal collapse.

summary.userTemplate: You chose: {decisionSummary}. In your version of events, Rome’s fate followed your path.
summary.historicalOutcome: Historically, Julius Caesar was appointed Dictator in 49 BC, leading to the end of the Republic and the rise of the Empire under Augustus.

decisionPoints.question: Rome is plagued by corruption and political gridlock. How do you seize the moment to assert your influence?

options.text: Declare Yourself 'Dictator in Times of Crisis'
options.feedback: Your bold declaration rallies the legions but alienates the Senate and traditionalists.

options.text: Forge a Power-Sharing Pact with the Senate
options.feedback: Your diplomatic approach consolidates support among Rome’s elites, though some view it as overly cautious.

options.text: Quietly Build Alliances Among Rome’s Elite
options.feedback: Steady alliances form in the shadows, but the absence of a clear public stance leaves uncertainty about your intentions.

decisionPoints.question: A powerful rival faction emerges, rallying opposition and destabilizing the Republic. How do you neutralize this threat?

options.feedback: Your military might crushes the opposition, yet the heavy toll risks igniting further unrest.

options.text: Negotiate a Compromise by Integrating Their Leaders
options.feedback: Bringing rivals into your fold creates a fragile unity, though critics whisper of compromised authority.

options.text: Undertake Covert Operations to Undermine Them
options.feedback: Your secret maneuvers yield mixed success—enemies falter, yet suspicion grows among your own ranks.

decisionPoints.question: The people are restless amid power struggles. How will you restore faith and maintain order?

options.text: Initiate Sweeping Social and Economic Reforms with Public Oratory
options.feedback: Your reformist zeal wins hearts, though state coffers feel the strain.

options.text: Enforce Strict Control with Military and Legal Measures
options.feedback: Order is reestablished, yet the draconian measures plant seeds of future resentment.

options.text: Call a Grand Assembly of Senators and Citizens
options.feedback: The assembly brings unity and dialogue, but its slow pace may hinder urgent actions.
